fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.locale

Interface ILocaleService


  • @SystemService
public interface ILocaleService
    Provides localization support as a broker between resources associated with specific locales and resources providing translated text representations.

    Users are an example of resources associated with specific locales. Dictionaries (and implementations of ITranslated) are examples of resources providing translated text representations.

    Thread safety: implementations are required to be safe for concurrent access.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Detail

      • getDictionary

        IDictionary getDictionary(String dictionaryName,
                          DictionaryType dictionaryType,
                          FormatType formatType)
                   throws NullPointerException,
                          IllegalArgumentException,
                          IOException
        Gets the named dictionary by resolving the name by locating a specific resource based on the dictionary type.

        The dictionary resource is automatically associated with the bundle that requested it (for example, the default assumption is that the calling bundle provides the dictionary as an embedded resource).

        This method is idempotent: calling it more than once from a specific bundle will yield the same result (the same dictionary instance). The first invocation will automatically register the dictionary as an OSGi service.

        Parameters:
        dictionaryName - the dictionary name, without any path or filename extension. Must be non-empty and composed of Unicode letters or digits, underscores, hyphens, and full stops.
        dictionaryType - the non-null dictionary type.
        formatType - if the dictionary includes any text templates (strings with text that should replaced with variable data), this specifies which interpolation format is expected. If null, then the dictionary is not expected to contain any text templates.
        Returns:
        the requested dictionary, or null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any required parameter is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is invalid.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs loading dictionary data.
        Since:
        1.0
        See Also:
        getText(java.util.Locale, IDictionary, String, Object...), getText(ILocalized, IDictionary, String, Object...)

      • toTemplateDictionary

        ITemplateDictionary toTemplateDictionary(IDictionary dictionary,
                                         Locale locale)
        Creates a new instance of a template dictionary, contextualizing operations for a dictionary with the specified locale.
        Parameters:
        dictionary - the non-null dictionary instance.
        locale - the non-null contextual locale.
        Returns:
        a new template dictionary instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • negotiateLocale

        Locale negotiateLocale(Locale desiredLocale,
                       Collection<Locale> availableLocales)
        Provides locale negotiation to select the best-match for a desired locale from a collection of available locales.

        If the exact match can be found, it is returned. If not, then the country is ignored and a locale with the same language is sought. If a match still cannot be found, then either an English or a French locale will be returned, if in the list of available locales.

        When no suitable match can be identified, an invariant neutral (or "global") locale should be assumed when selecting a representation.

        This exposes the same algorithm used internally by the various getText methods defined by this service.

        Parameters:
        desiredLocale - the non-null desired locale.
        availableLocales - the collection of available locales. May be null and may contain null elements.
        Returns:
        the closest match from the available list, or null.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getText

        String getText(Locale desiredLocale,
               ITranslated translatedObject)
        Gets the localized text for the specified locale (or negotiates the closent match) from the specified translated object.
        Parameters:
        desiredLocale - the desired locale for the localized text, or null (when null, the neutral global text of the translated object will be selected).
        translatedObject - the object defining localized text variants (and neutral global text), or null.
        Returns:
        the best-match text or the neutral global text. The best-match is selected using the standard negotiation algorithm. If translatedObject was null, then returns null. Otherwise, if desiredLocale was null, the global text will be returned.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getText

        String getText(ILocalized localizedObject,
               ITranslated translatedObject)
        Gets the localized text for locale defined by a localized object (or negotiates the closent match) from the specified translated object. If the localized object does not actually define the locale (the locale preference is an optional attribute), or if no suitable equivalent can be selected, then the neutral global text will be returned.
        Parameters:
        localizedObject - the object that may define the locale to use for selecting text (if it does not define the locale, then the neutral global text will be returned).
        translatedObject - the object defining localized text variants (and neutral global text).
        Returns:
        the best-match text or the neutral global text. The best-match is selected using the standard negotiation algorithm. If translatedObject was null, then returns null. Otherwise, if localizedObject was null (or did not define a locale), the global text will be returned.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getText

        String getText(Locale desiredLocale,
               IDictionary dictionary,
               String key,
               Object... args)
        Gets the localized dictionary text for the specified locale (or negotiates the closent match), optionally merging in formatting arguments.
        Parameters:
        desiredLocale - the non-null desired locale for the localized dictionary text.
        dictionary - the dictionary containing localized text, and defining the format type.
        key - the key identifying text or a template in the dictionary.
        args - 0..n formatting parameters that must be compatible with the template defined with the specified key.
        Returns:
        the best-match text or the specified key if no suitable match can be selected. The best-match is selected using the standard negotiation algorithm.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the dictionary does not define a format type when formatting parameters are specified.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getText

        String getText(ILocalized localizedObject,
               IDictionary dictionary,
               String key,
               Object... args)
        Gets the localized dictionary text for the specified locale (or negotiates the closent match), optionally merging in formatting arguments.
        Parameters:
        localizedObject - the object that may define the locale to use for selecting text (if it does not define the locale, then the key will be returned).
        dictionary - the dictionary containing localized text, and defining the format type.
        key - the key identifying text or a template in the dictionary.
        args - 0..n formatting parameters that must be compatible with the template defined with the specified key.
        Returns:
        the best-match text or the specified key if no suitable match can be selected. The best-match is selected using the standard negotiation algorithm.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the dictionary does not define a format type when formatting parameters are specified.
        Since:
        1.0
